MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult AddEarcon (string earcon, string packagename, int resourceId);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult AddEarcon(string earcon, string packagename, int32 resourceId) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the earcon. Example: "[tick]"

the package name of the application that contains the resource. This can for instance be the package name of your own application. Example: "com.google.marvin.compass"
The package name can be found in the AndroidManifest.xml of the application containing the resource.
<manifest xmlns:android="..." package="com.google.marvin.compass">
Docs.summary: Adds a mapping between a string of text and a sound resource in a package.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult AddSpeech (Java.Lang.ICharSequence text, string packagename, int resourceId);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult AddSpeech(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence text, string packagename, int32 resourceId) cil managed

Docs.param:
Pass the packagename of the application that contains the resource. If the resource is in your own application (this is the most common case), then put the packagename of your application here.
Example: "com.google.marvin.compass"
The packagename can be found in the AndroidManifest.xml of your application.
<manifest xmlns:android="..." package="com.google.marvin.compass">
Docs.summary: Adds a mapping between a CharSequence (may be spanned with TtsSpans) of text and a sound resource in a package.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult PlayEarcon (string earcon, Android.Speech.Tts.QueueMode queueMode, System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,string> params);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult PlayEarcon(string earcon, valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.QueueMode queueMode, class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> params) cil managed

Docs.summary: Plays the earcon using the specified queueing mode and parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult PlayEarcon (string earcon, Android.Speech.Tts.QueueMode queueMode, Android.OS.Bundle params, string utteranceId);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult PlayEarcon(string earcon, valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.QueueMode queueMode, class Android.OS.Bundle params, string utteranceId) cil managed

Docs.param: The earcon that should be played

Parameters for the request. Can be null. Supported parameter names: , Engine specific parameters may be passed in but the parameter keys must be prefixed by the name of the engine they are intended for. For example the keys "com.svox.pico_foo" and "com.svox.pico:bar" will be passed to the engine named "com.svox.pico" if it is being used.
Docs.summary: Plays the earcon using the specified queueing mode and parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult SetPitch (float pitch);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult SetPitch(float32 pitch) cil managed

Docs.param: Speech pitch. 1.0 is the normal pitch, lower values lower the tone of the synthesized voice, greater values increase it.
Docs.summary: Sets the speech pitch for the TextToSpeech engine.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult SetSpeechRate (float speechRate);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult SetSpeechRate(float32 speechRate) cil managed

Docs.param: Speech rate. 1.0 is the normal speech rate, lower values slow down the speech (0.5 is half the normal speech rate), greater values accelerate it (2.0 is twice the normal speech rate).
Docs.summary: Sets the speech rate.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult Speak (string text, Android.Speech.Tts.QueueMode queueMode, System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,string> params);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult Speak(string text, valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.QueueMode queueMode, class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> params) cil managed

Docs.summary: Speaks the text using the specified queuing strategy and speech parameters, the text may be spanned with TtsSpans.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult Speak (Java.Lang.ICharSequence text, Android.Speech.Tts.QueueMode queueMode, Android.OS.Bundle params, string utteranceId);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult Speak(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence text, valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.QueueMode queueMode, class Android.OS.Bundle params, string utteranceId) cil managed

Docs.param: The string of text to be spoken. No longer than characters.
The queuing strategy to use, or .

Parameters for the request. Can be null. Supported parameter names: , , . Engine specific parameters may be passed in but the parameter keys must be prefixed by the name of the engine they are intended for. For example the keys "com.svox.pico_foo" and "com.svox.pico:bar" will be passed to the engine named "com.svox.pico" if it is being used.
An unique identifier for this request.
Docs.summary: Speaks the text using the specified queuing strategy and speech parameters, the text may be spanned with TtsSpans.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult SynthesizeToFile (Java.Lang.ICharSequence text, Android.OS.Bundle params, Java.IO.File file, string utteranceId);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult SynthesizeToFile(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence text, class Android.OS.Bundle params, class Java.IO.File file, string utteranceId) cil managed

Docs.param: The text that should be synthesized. No longer than characters.

Parameters for the request. Can be null. Engine specific parameters may be passed in but the parameter keys must be prefixed by the name of the engine they are intended for. For example the keys "com.svox.pico_foo" and "com.svox.pico:bar" will be passed to the engine named "com.svox.pico" if it is being used.
File to write the generated audio data to.
An unique identifier for this request.
Docs.summary: Synthesizes the given text to a file using the specified parameters.
